channel.title: Perl Weekly newsletter
channel.description: A free, once a week e-mail round-up of hand-picked news and articles about Perl.

item.title: #40 - Perl 5.16.0 is coming soon!
item.description:
Hi,

It was late Sunday evening when I was trying to put together this edition and I was way too tired for this. At one point I noticed I was going over the same items I did last week. Clearly I need a better way to manage the links I collect. It is on its way but other tasks constantly get in front of it.

For this issue, I had to reduce the amount of comments so I could finish it before midnight.

BTW Miguel Prz (niceperl) started a new weekly posting. This time with his MetaCPAN favourites.

Now to the posts:

item.title: Perl 5.16.0 is coming soon!
item.description: If Perl is an important tool in your toolbox then follow what Ricardo SIGNES is asking you and test it. Before the release!

item.title: Padre 0.96 has been released...
item.description: After another long release cycle, Peter Lavender reports the new version of Padre. Two more and we arrive at the magical 1.00 release.

item.title: Send A Newbie
item.description: The new round of the Send a Newbie to YAPC program was announced by Mark Keating.

item.title: (i) MetaCPAN favourites weekly report
item.description: This is the second weekly blog post published by Miguel Prz (niceperl). In this one he is listing the modules that gained the most +-es on MetaCPAN.

item.title: Speed up by a factor of 6 million
item.description: Carl M�sak looks at a Perl 6 script that arrives to the same solution as his C program but 6 million times faster. That sounds crazy but interesting. He discusses the Perl 5 solution written by Salvador Fandino and then provides a Perl 6 solution to the same problem.

item.title: Ubic - status report
item.description: 'Ubic is a polymorphic service manager which makes creating daemons easy, while being extensible in a several different ways' writes Vyacheslav Matjukhin after a long break in reporting about his module. He mixes a big dose of technical update with information on talks showing the project and ideas about reaching out to potential users. Not only Perl developers.

item.title: RT fixes for Perl DBD::Oracle and request for people using TAF
item.description: Martin Evans

item.title: This is why I love Template Toolkit
item.description: Aaron Trevena learns about the META directive of TT.

item.title: Alien::Base Perl Foundation Grant Report Month 2
item.description: by Joel Berger

item.title: Embrace the Little Conveniences
item.description: Do you use File::Slurp or write your own slurp() function? Do you use Proc::Fork or call fork() by yourself? What does chromatic do?

item.title: Before you write a patch, write an email
item.description: Andy Lester offers his opinion on how to approach an open source project with patches. I am not sure. I think, while this make sense, is in contradiction with the earlier message: 'code speaks'. So what do you think?

item.title: Perl Hackathon QA 2012
item.description: Apparently the flow of reports from the QA Hackathons still has not dryed up. This time Geistteufel, the celogeek, wrote up a few words and add links to some pictures.

item.title: Websockets in nginx-perl
item.description: A few simple examples by Alexandr Gomoliako.

item.title: How do you pass the PostData argument to the Navigate method of IWebBrowser2 using Win32::OLE?
item.description: by Sinan Unur

item.title: My personalized Perl bumper sticker
item.description: Ron Savage has a a Perl-powered Toyota hybrid!

item.title: Ninja Code
item.description: That's just scary. (The second post of Chris Grau)

item.title: Perl devroom @FOSDEM2012: photos
item.description: Claudio Ramirez El-Che

item.title: Revenge of the Oslo hackathon
item.description: Carl M�sak breaks a month of blog-silence and writes about the Perl 6 hackathon in Oslo from his point of view.

item.title: Back from Oslo
item.description: Tadeusz Sosnierz (tadzik) discovered that the Perl 6 Hackathon is better than bacon with maasdamer. Or at least on the same level. I think I am not supposed to comment on this.

item.title: Perl 6 Hackathon in Oslo: Report From The Second Day
item.description: by Moritz Lenz

item.title: Post-hackathon thoughts
item.description: by Jan Ingvoldstad

item.title: Rakudo Star 2012.04 - a useful, usable, 'early adopter' distribution of Perl 6
Post-mortem Linguistics in Zurich
item.description: by Damian Conway. Tuesday May 8, 2012.

item.title: Quantum-Relativistic Time-Travel in Lisbon
item.description: by Damian Conway. Thursday May 3, 2012

item.title: Splice to slice and dice arrays in Perl
item.description: Part of the Perl Maven tutorial/book.

item.title: Facebook vs Google+ for Perl projects
item.description: Listing the pages and comparing number of followers. If you are on either of those social networks, you might want to check out what pages you could follow.

item.title: Perl Mova Workshop in Kiev
item.description: May 12-13, 2012, Kiev, Ukraine

item.title: Nordic Perl workshop
item.description: June 4-5, 2012, Stockholm, Sweden

item.title: YAPC::NA
item.description: June 13-15, 2012, Madison, Wisconsin, USA

item.title: French Perl workshop
